content.question: Which of the following best explains how the spread of racialist beliefs such as Social Darwinism contributed to outbreaks of genocide in twentieth-century Europe?

choices.label: These belief systems were often seen as contradicting many of the central tenets of Christianity.
These belief systems portrayed the relationship among nations as a struggle for existence.
These belief systems were increasingly challenged by European scientists.
These belief systems were often used to counter universalist ideologies such as communism.

content.answer: These belief systems portrayed the relationship among nations as a struggle for existence.
